alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:09PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Stone, southeastern Searcy, northeastern Van Buren and northwestern Cleburne Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1008 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rocky Hill, or 10 miles northwest of Clinton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mountain View... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Greers Ferry... Shirley... Higden... Fairfield Bay Marina... Rocky Hill... Elba... Sugar Loaf Recreation Area... Old Lexington... Elberta... Leslie... Parma... Hanover... Rushing... Turkey Creek... Dennard... Timbo... Narrows Marina... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Cleburne; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations
